CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1964, pg. 6, reads: "CUTTING CAKE - Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Burns Jr. cut the first slice of their wedding cake, following their recent marriage in home of the bride's parents, the Rev. W. R. Shields and the late Mrs. Beulah Shields, the bride is the former Mary Louise Clark. - Harris Photo.  Article reads: "Home Rites Unite Pair.  During a recent wedding, charming nary Louise Clark, became the bride of Arthur Burns Jr.  The nuptials tool place at the residence of the bride's parents, the Rev. W. R. Shields and the late Mrs. Buelah [sic] Shields.  For her marriage, the bride wore a dress of blue silk georgette.  Her blue satin chapeau was a Glo Miller creation.  Mrs. Willa Lewis, sister of the bride, was matron of honor.  The groom's brother, William Burns, was best man and the Rev. C. Leroy Hacker officiated at the rites.  An informal reception followed the rites at the Greene Hearthe [sic].  The groom is national sales manager for the Crayton Southern Sausage Co."
TitMainTitle: Groom Arthur Burns Jr. wearing grid patterned suit, bride Mary Louise Clark Burns wearing light blue silk georgette dress and satin pillbox hat with veil, cutting two tiered cake in Greene Hearth
